entry.title: How to report on the events and change history of compensation data in SAP Story report?
entry.content:
Product: SAP SuccessFactors People Analytics

Product Function: Story Reports

Detailed Description: Hello,
I wish to report on historical changes made to compensation of employees in SAP Story report. For example, if an employee had a salary of 10 on 1st April 2025, then the salary got increased to 12 on 1st July 2025, I want to pull this data into the data model of SAP Story.

entry.title: Re: Fiori Reuse Library Application Log 'script load error'
entry.content:
Hi All,

The same requirement existed for a Fiori Elements application in SAP BAS, and I solved it by comparing it with WebIDE.

Firstly, I added a Reuse Library with the selecting source type ABAP at WebIDE. Then, I converted it in BAS using the Fiori Tools Migration Tool and checked what had changed. After that, I successfully used the Reuse Library in BAS by adding the following commands to ui5.yaml.

Reuse Library Name : sap.nw.core.applogs.lib.reuse

ICF Path : /sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/nw_aps_apl_lib (From Fiori Library)

entry.title: Smartfield with search help and external parameter
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I have a query about some development work. I created a smart field in an XML view. This smart field contains warehouse data. This information depends on the 'Plant' field.

When the search help is opened, the view receives the data from the plant field and filters the warehouse for this plant, which is fine so far.

However, when I select a warehouse code, for example 'AACC', the search help closes and the backend is called to verify the selected value. During this process, the front end does not send the plant value to the back end. Consequently, the system retrieves a lot of warehouses with the code 'AACC'. The system then returns an error message.

What can I do to solve the problem?

Thank you so much!

entry.title: Re: question about the option to upload / import data on ad-hoc items
entry.content:
Hi Suraj,

ad hoc item is a standard master data object in group reporting.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Group_Reporting_Data_Collection/64dc0138def94c6696ee1ed4701d53f7/c6e1cc9efe9a44eda5cbb71ae3d2e605.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

"Ad hoc items can be used as additional dimensions for a financial statement item where you need to collect data values for a consolidation unit or consolidation group in group reporting. These ad hoc items facilitate the naming, collection, and reporting of a set of values that are supplemental to the modeled financial data."

This is master data that is managed and owned by GRDC.

Best regards

Michael

entry.title: Re: Exchange rate difference accounts are incomplete for...
entry.content:
Even though:

Company Code Currency = EUR
Group Currency = USD
Open items and account currency = EUR

SAP still performs currency translation for Group Currency during clearing. If there's any minor difference due to rounding or exchange rate fluctuations between document and clearing dates, SAP needs a G/L account to post the gain/loss in Group Currency (USD). So yes, you need to configure exchange rate difference accounts in OBA1, even if the transaction currency is the same as the company code currency. Even if the actual postings are rare or zero, SAP needs these accounts defined to proceed with clearing.

To answer your question "Can it be deactivated for these cases?", No, you should not.

entry.title: Re: Error: Class does not implement if_oo_adt_classrun~main method!
entry.content:
Hello, 
Workaround I've used so far and it worked: 
 I have created an additional method namely "sub_methods_with_output" as private and moved group_id variable to public section.
Below is the code snippet : 

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES if_oo_adt_classrun.

    DATA:
  group_id   TYPE string VALUE 'xxx'.  

PRIVATE SECTION.

    METHODS:
      sub_methods_with_output
        IMPORTING
          io_out TYPE REF TO if_oo_adt_classrun_out.n_out.

METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.
 sub_methods_with_output( out ).
ENDMETHOD.

 METHOD sub_methods_with_output.
    io_out->write( |[RAP100] Demo data generated for table ZRAP100_ATRAV{ group_id }. | ).
  ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Triggering Process in Shared Environment from SAP Build Apps - Better Solution 😸
entry.content:
In my previous blog post Triggering Process in Shared Environments from SAP Build Apps,  I showed you how to trigger from SAP Build Apps a process that was deployed to a shared environment  -- using HTTP Destination Request instead of Processes flow functions.

Though I thought it was pretty easy -- and I liked it because I could control the API call and see what was going on under the hood -- it still required me to know the APIs as well as to give up on some of the cool SAP Build Apps capabilities that come with the Processes flow functions (like automatic generation of schemas from inputs/outputs of a process).

Thanks to @KuroKen, I discovered a better way, who commented on my original post.

At first I struggled to get the solution to work, even though I was assured it worked. But as usual, the struggling was good and revealed all kinds of additional nuances about the system (see Issues below). After 2 weeks of study, here's my explanation of this solution.

The Problem (reminder)

SAP Build Apps has a wonderful set of flow functions that makes it easy to trigger processes (and run other SAP Build Process Automation APIs). 

But the problem is that they were developed before SAP Build environments was a big thing, and certainly before the Public environment was deprecated. The API to trigger a process in a shared environment requires a query parameter specifying the environment, but the flow functions do not include this parameter and therefore the flow function can only trigger Public processes, which as we said are deprecated.

🙀

The Solution

Well, it is pretty simple -- don't require the query parameter.

But how?

When creating the SAP Build Process Automation instance in the SAP BTP cockpit, you can add a small configuration  that will assign that instance to a specific shared environment so you will not have to pass the environment name when you call the API.

To set up SAP Build Process Automation, you need to create an instance of the service. In the cockpit click Create.

You select SAP Build Process Automation, and select the standard instance plan. 

Instead of clicking Create, click Next so you can add a configuration to specify a shared environment to connect to this instance. In the dialog, you enter an environment ID and an API key with rights to trigger processes and more.

The following is the dialog where you post your configuration:

The following is an example of the JSON to set (you need to replace with your own environment ID and API key):

{
    "environmentId": "salesgroup",
    "apiKey": "fPdjgABCD-wZUckjh-c6e2wFyU3SgL"
}

 If you already have an instance, you can run Update and then supply the JSON.

Some of this process is described here: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-process-automation/sap-build-process-automation/update-service-instance

Environment ID

The environment ID can be found when you go to Control Tower and open your environment, under Identifier.

API Key

Within the environment, you can go to the API Keys tab and create a new API key.

For the key you must give it enough scope for triggering processes, specifically the environment_read, trigger_read and trigger_execute scopes.

 

How You Trigger Process from SAP Build Apps

Now that we have overcome the problem with shared environments, here's a quick review of how to trigger a process from SAP Build Apps.

  1. Publish your deployed process project.
  2.  In SAP Build Apps, go to Integrations > Add Integration > Library, and select the process you want to expose from within the deployed project (which should appear since the project was published). Click Enable Process. 
  3. In the logic canvas (perhaps in response to a button), drag in a Processes > Trigger Process flow function. 
  4. In the flow function, specify the process to trigger and the inputs for the process.

 

Issues

The main issue was that I was using a destination with OAuth2JWTBearer (user authentication). The above works currently only for OAuth2ClientCredentials. So when @KuroKen explained his solution, I didn't understand because it didn't work for me, and he must of thought I was incompetent or crazy.

I contacted development and they confirmed that I was not crazy, that in fact there was a bug -- the client credentials and user token authentication flows used different flows and the one for user tokens had a bug. My understanding is that that bug was fixed and is awaiting deployment. As always,, no guarantees

Potential pitfall

This solution works like a charm, and restores all the great capabilities of SAP Build Apps flow functions. And as long as long as there are only a few environments, it should work pretty well.

But let's say I have 3 environments, and I create 3 instances of SAP Build Process Automation, each will require its own destination to define the connection from SAP Build Apps. But SAP Build Apps assumes the name of the destination is sap_process_automation_service_user_access. So in a  case where I want to trigger processes in different environments from my app, I think I would have a problem -- though I do not know how common a use case that would be.

I am told that there is no cost or performance issue for creating multiple instances, so that is good.

I assume that I can override the configuration by sending the query parameter for another environment, but I have not tested this.

Hope this helps,

😸

entry.title: Usage of HTML <code> tag in SAP Community posts/blogs
entry.content:
For better readability, I want to use the HTML tag <code> in my SAP Community blog to highlight words or short text sections as computer code.

Adding the below HTML string via the editor formatting option "Source Code" (HTML) leads to the expected rendering, in the editor:

The <code>push()</code> method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array.

 

After I click Post, I get the following error message:

> Your post has been adjusted to remove unsupported HTML found in the message body. The HTML has been updated. Please review the post and send it when you are satisfied

And the HTML code tags have been removed. 

Is the HTML code tag not supported anymore? How is it possible to highlight computer code inline (single words) in the post/blog body?

Checking other blog posts seems to work using HTML code tags, e.g. https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/ui5-s-unified-test-tech-stack/ba-p/13581038 

Thanks for your support!

entry.title: Автоматичний преклад SAP українською
entry.content:
Відкривайте світ SAP українською: автоматичний переклад help.sap.com

Незважаючи на те, що за багато років я звикла працювати англійською з документацією SAP, маю зазначити, що автоматичний переклад help.sap.com та використання рідної української мови значно покращує порозуміння суті процесів під час обговорення з користувачами. Саме тому я була в захваті, коли побачила можливість миттєвого перекладу документації SAP українською мовою.

За різними оцінками, лише близько 20-25% населення планети володіє англійською мовою на рівні, достатньому для роботи з  документацією. Це означає, що автоматичний переклад – це не просто зручність, а величезний крок для покращення адаптації рішень SAP, які використовуються у понад 180 країнах світу.

На щастя, українська є серед 39 мов, що підтримуються SAP Translation Hub (STH). І це не випадковість, а результат активної позиції та наполегливої роботи команди SAP Україна. Це величезне досягнення для нашої мови та визнання її значущості у глобальному бізнес-середовищі.

Як працює новий інструмент перекладу?

SAP впровадив машинний переклад безпосередньо на порталі help.sap.com, що дозволяє миттєво отримувати контент українською. Переклад здійснюється за допомогою передової технології машинного навчання, що забезпечує якісну локалізацію навіть складних технічних термінів. Вам більше не потрібно використовувати сторонні інструменти чи перекладачі – все інтегровано безпосередньо на порталі.

Як скористатися функцією перекладу?

  1. Відвідайте будь-яку сторінку на help.sap.com та оберіть рішення, що вас цікавить
  2. Знайдіть перемикач мов у верхньому меню сторінки
  3. Оберіть українську мову зі списку доступних мов
  4. Насолоджуйтесь миттєвим перекладом усього контенту!

Важливо: якщо ви помітите неточності в перекладі, SAP також надає можливість залишити відгук, що допоможе постійно вдосконалювати якість перекладу.

Використання SAP Translation Hub для власних потреб

Варто зазначити, що клієнти SAP можуть використовувати SAP Translation Hub для власних потреб перекладу інтерфейсу системи, документації та інших матеріалів. Цей хмарний сервыс дозволяє автоматично перекладати користувацькі інтерфейси та документацію, забезпечує перевірку контексту перекладу через функцію попереднього перегляду, дозволяє створювати глосарії для підтримки узгодженої термінології, надає можливість управління перекладацькими проектами через зручний веб-інтерфейс,

Навіть якщо ви досвідчений користувач, пропоную вам просто сьогодні спробувати цю функцію і переконатися, наскільки зручніше працювати з документацією рідною мовою. Часом це не лише питання комфорту, але й точності розуміння складних процесів та функціоналу.

Детальніше про нову функцію автоматичного перекладу можна дізнатися за посиланням: SAP HelpPortal з машинним перекладом

А яка ваша думка? Чи використовуєте ви вже цю функцію? Поділіться своїми враженнями у коментарях

entry.title: Re: ABAP Extensibility Guide – Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud - August 2025 Update
entry.content:
Hi @OlgaDolinskaja ,

In section 5.1.1 of the ABAP Extensibility Guide  it states:
“DDIC objects are therefore also not checked by ATC checks in case they are used as data types.
SAP DDIC objects can be seen as central reusable data types for classic ABAP development without any restriction. Only the SQL access to SAP tables is addressed by ATC.”

Does this mean that when DDIC objects are used as data type references, they are considered level B even if those objects are not released?

For example, in the case of

DATA company TYPE t001.

to make it level A it would have to be written as

DATA company TYPE i_companycode.

but without modification it would still be level B — is that correct?

When directly using table types, whether as type references or through ABAP SQL access, any changes to the table due to an upgrade will have a direct impact, so it feels a bit inconsistent…

Thanks.

entry.title: Assistance Required: Document Transfer Post HR Approval in Document Management Hub
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I’m currently working on a requirement to transfer documents from a custom MDF object to the Document Management Hub once they are approved by HR. However, I’m facing a challenge in identifying whether the attachment has been approved or not.

At present, I’m using the following API call:
Attachment("1019431")?$format=JSON
Unfortunately, this does not provide any indication of the approval status of the document.

Here are the workarounds I’ve attempted so far:

  1. Dropdown in MDF Object: I added a dropdown field to track approval status, but it’s not editable during the HR workflow. Additionally, it cannot be auto-populated via business rules.
  2. Using KBA 3446322: I tried accessing /odata/v2/WfRequest(1301L)/wfRequestStepNav, which does return the approval status. However, it’s difficult to correlate this with the specific document being approved.

What I’m looking for:
Has anyone encountered a similar situation? I’d appreciate any suggestions, workarounds, or innovative ideas to reliably determine whether a document has been approved and then trigger its transfer to the Document Management Hub.

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,
Tarun

entry.title: AI-Assisted Note Corrections for Project Billing
entry.content:
Relevant for SAP Cloud ERP 2508. 

Introducing GenAI features in Project Billing 

With the 2508 release of SAP Cloud ERP, we are excited to introduce new intelligent features in Project Billing that will revolutionize the way you process your bills. These enhancements are designed to make billing more efficient and accurate, saving you valuable time and effort. 

The Role of Billing Specialists 

Billing Specialists play a crucial role in reviewing cost postings recorded by consultants working on customer projects and preparing the bill. This process involves verifying the correct net rate, deciding which cost postings to include in the billing cycle, and determining the amount to bill.  

Smart Notes 

One of the most time-consuming tasks in this process of bill preparation is manually reviewing the notes maintained by consultants in the hundreds of cost postings considered for billing. 

This is where the Smart Notes feature in Project Billing comes to your rescue. Smart Notes is an AI-assisted feature that proposes grammatically corrected notes for items of the Time & Expenses (T&E) billing method with notes. These proposed notes are not only grammatically correct but also free from spelling errors. 

The biggest advantage of Smart Notes is that you can get these note proposals with a single click of the Smart Notes button in the Prepare Billing screen of the Manage Project Billing app. We support up to 500 T&E items with notes for note proposals in a single click. 

Flexibility and Control 

Billing Specialists have the flexibility to decide which note proposals should be accepted and saved, and which ones should be updated before saving. This way, we leverage the capability of GenAI to make your billing preparation faster while ensuring that the final decision on what notes are saved rests with the Billing Specialist. 

The feature best works for notes in English language. But do let us know your feedback for note proposals for notes in other languages.  

The notes saved in the Manage Project Billing app are also propagated to the Billing Document itemized list. This means that the note proposals reviewed and saved by the Billing Specialists can be made available in the Billing Document shared with your customer. This ensures that the notes are clear, self-explanatory and professional, reducing the time to settle the bill due to unclear communication. 

 

Prerequisites 

To activate the Smart Notes feature, the following prerequisites must be in place: 

  • SAP AI Units 
  • Joule Premium for Financial Management 

Activation Steps  

You can get the Smart Notes feature activated via SAP for Me by navigating to: 

  • Dashboard- Portfolio & Products 
  • Business AI 
  • Look for the feature – Note Corrections for Project billing, in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  
  • Request Activation  

Summary  

The Smart Notes feature in the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release is set to transform the billing process, making it more efficient and accurate. By leveraging GenAI, we ensure that your billing preparation is faster and the communication with your customers is clear and professional. 

We hope you find this new feature exciting and beneficial. Happy billing!

entry.title: Re: Compare two clients (SAP environments) with SAP Signavio
entry.content:
Dear Jessica,

before I go to each of your questions I would like to say that plug & gain is an approach or a so called Value Accelerator of Signavio that allows you to integrate Process Insights with Intelligence and Process Manager. Please be aware that this approach sticks to the SAP Standard.

1. The limitation would be on the volume of the data that you can collect and store. The total storage used is based on the data size of all performance indicators for which data has been collected and also other technical objects relating to business object data. This information helps you understand how much of your available storage your organization is consuming.

2. It can and should be used individually. With Process Intelligence you can run deep analysis and build your own KPI's and Investigations.

3. You can use SAP Help to find different Guidelines. https://help.sap.com/  I hope the one you need is there. If not I recommend you to find some experts in the field of Case Centric Process Mining that will help and guide you to consolidate all the data.

4. Plug&Gain is an approach that can be installed from the Process Manager under Value Accelerator. There you find a guide on all the Prerequisits that you need to fulfill to install it. 

With intsallation you will have information on 3 sides: Process Manager/Process Insights and Process Intelligence. You can navigate through the rocesses in Process Manager and from there jump to Process Insights or Process Intelligence. In Process Intelligence you will have already build in Dashboards with KPI's -out of the box- on different topics with explanations. Of course you can also build your own investigations with help of widgets or also by using SIGNAL. 

I hope my answers helped you!

Best

Rada

entry.title: When consuming a BW query through an import connection in SAC, users are unable to view prompt
entry.content:
Dear SAP Team,

In SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), we created an import model based on a BW query that includes parameters. While consuming this import model in SAC, we can view and apply filters using the BW parameters. However, the functionality to view or change the full list of parameter values directly in the SAC report is not available. Also, there is no option to select all available values for the BW parameters while creating the SAC import model. 

The model was created by selecting specific parameter values, along with the necessary dimensions and measures, and applying required data transformations during the import process. 

Best Regards,

Govardhan

La cabecera del json es la siguiente:

{
  "d" : {
    "CompanyCode" : "0600",
    "SuplrInvcDebitCrdtCodeReturns": "S",
    "SupplierInvoiceIsCreditMemo": true ,
    "DocumentDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
    "PostingDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
    "SupplierInvoiceIDByInvcgParty" : "Test12",
    "InvoicingParty" : "1001260",
    "DocumentCurrency" : "EUR",
    "InvoiceGrossAmount" : "121",
    "DueCalculationBaseDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
    "TaxIsCalculatedAutomatically" : true,
    "TaxDeterminationDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
 
Sin embargo nos devuelve el error: "Failed to read property 'SupplierInvoiceIsCreditMemo' at offset '121'" hemos comprobado que la estructura del json es la correcta, ¿Pueden indicarnos si debemos de pasar algún parámetro más o indicarnos donde se encuentra el error?

entry.title: Switching Your Tax Procedure or External Tax Provider (United States Sales and Use Tax)
entry.content:
To state the obvious: Getting your taxes right is an important part of your business, and it’s not an area where you’d typically seek out additional complexities.

This is the shortest possible version of why it’s difficult to change your sales and use tax procedure in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Your tax procedure is something you set up in your initial scoping, and it is in most cases the deepest asleep of all of your sleeping dogs. Almost all the time, you just want to leave it alone.

Almost. There are times when you need to make a change. Perhaps your business structure has changed sufficiently that you want to move from the internal tax calculation procedure to the external and join up with a tax partner. Or maybe you need to switch tax partners.

In these cases, with live systems, you need to think carefully, plan for disruption, think again, and plan some more. And then probably do that one more time. Then if you’re going ahead, consult our KBA entitled Information on the Internal Tax Calculation Procedure (TAXUSJ) to the External Tax Calculation Procedure (0TXUSX) for more detailed information on the procedure, risks, and potential downtimes associated with such a switch.

entry.title: Re: When consuming a BW query through an import connectio...
entry.content:
@govardhan_vegi98 

As you have created the import model based on the query, the filters will only be available in the model query which will just filter the data flowing to the this import model. The story based on this import model is like a normal story based on a import model which will not have any filters of the original BW query.

If it was live model based on BW query you might have got the filters in the story.

 

Nikhil

Hi @cassio_amparo,

In the app: F4603, you can view the costs in the graph when pointing out with the mouse. You can play around with the filters and "view by" option so you can see the costs per order.

 

If you want the cost values to actually show up on the graph, you’ll probably need to build a custom analytical report or use another app like Actual Cost Analysis (F3567), which gives a bit more flexibility with charts.

Another simple option is to export the data to Excel and create your own chart there with the numbers displayed.

Best regards,

Luisa

entry.title: Importing Master data for SAP_FI_FPA_IM_S4_Finance_Planning
entry.content:
Subject: Unable to Load Dimension SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT from S/4HANA Public Cloud into SAC Planning

We are facing an issue when trying to load master data into the SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT dimension in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Planning, using the pre-delivered Financial Planning Business Content.

System Setup

  • SAP Analytics Cloud: Business Content – Financial Planning

  • Backend system: S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Connection type: Import connection to S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Target Dimension: SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT

  • Query Used: A_GLAccountInChartOfAccounts

  • Model Used: SAP Finance (Financial) XP&A - Corp FP&A - Rapid Finance Planning & Analysis for SAP S/4HANA - ver 4 (2505 - May 2025)

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Deploy SAC Planning Financial Planning Business Content.

  2. Establish import connection to S/4HANA Public Cloud.

  3. Open Model → Dimension SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT → Import Data.

  4. Select connection to S/4HANA and choose query A_GLAccountInChartOfAccounts.

  5. Run data validation → no errors are detected.

  6. Execute data load.

Actual Result

  • Data load fails every time without a detailed error message.

  • Correlation ID: 1591349937304846b048723149393756

Expected Result

  • Dimension members should be successfully loaded from S/4HANA into SAC Planning.

entry.title: Re: Vendor Clearing Based on PO
entry.content:
The vendor line item in FI doesn’t automatically inherit the PO number unless it's explicitly passed during posting. Even if you’ve set the sort key in the vendor master or GL account master to include the PO number (I presume, you set the sort key 014), it only works if the PO number is available in the document at the time of posting. In advance payments, the PO number is often not entered or linked unless manually added to the assignment field.

In order to enable PO-based clearing in F-44, when posting the advance payment and invoice, manually enter the PO number in the assignment field (ZUONR). This ensures both line items carry the same reference and can be matched in F-44.

If you want this to happen without manual entry, then yes, an enhancement like BAdI FIMA_ASSIGNMENT or User exit in SAPMF05A can be used to fetch the PO number from the related logistics document and populate the assignment field on the vendor line item during posting.

entry.title: From Hype to Reality: AI Discovery Workshop in SAP Serialization Life Sciences
entry.content:
Big Ideas begin with small sketches

 

Over the past decade, serialization has become a cornerstone for ensuring compliance, traceability, and supply chain integrity, particularly in industries like pharmaceuticals, life sciences, and consumer goods. As regulations grow more complex and data volumes increase, the need for intelligent, automated insights within serialization processes has never been clearer.

That’s why we recently conducted an AI Discovery Workshop focused on SAP’s Serialization solution, bringing together cross-functional teams from over 17 largest companies in the US to explore how Artificial Intelligence can elevate serialization from a compliance tool into a strategic business enabler.

🔍 Why Focus on AI in Serialization?

SAP Serialization solutions provide rich, structured data - batch numbers, production line metrics, event histories, and global traceability records. This makes them an ideal foundation for AI-driven innovation.

During the workshop, we explored several high-impact use cases, including:

  • Predictive Exception Management – Flagging anomalies in serial number generation, shipping delays, or partner reporting issues.
  • Intelligent Root Cause Analysis – Using AI to trace deviations or failures back to specific batches, suppliers, or production events.
  • Smart Data handling – Automating error detection in serial number hierarchies across complex supply networks.

🧠 Leveraging the SAP AppHaus Approach for AI Innovation

A key differentiator of this workshop was running a Business AI Discovery Workshop, facilitated by @AmirBonakdar  from the SAP AppHaus. Grounded in SAP’s proven human-centered innovation methodology, this approach ensured we:

  • Empathized with serialization users — from supply chain managers to compliance officers — to uncover unmet needs and pain points.
  • Defined clear problem statements rooted in business impact.
  • Co-created practical AI use cases that are both technically feasible and truly valuable for end users.

💡 Workshop Insights: Beyond Compliance, Unlocking Real Business Value

  • Exception Management is a High-Impact Starting Point:
    Serialization data often surfaces numerous exceptions - missing serial numbers, shipment inconsistencies, or data input errors - that require manual investigation. The workshop highlighted how AI-driven predictive exception management can dramatically reduce manual effort by automatically flagging high-risk issues before they escalate, improving operational efficiency and reducing costly delays.
  • Value Extends Well Beyond Regulatory Compliance:
    While compliance remains fundamental, participants recognized serialization data as a rich source for strategic analytics. By leveraging AI, organizations can gain deeper supply chain visibility, optimize inventory flows, and enhance supplier collaboration - delivering tangible cost savings and customer satisfaction improvements.
  • Analytics as a Foundation for Continuous Improvement:
    Real-time AI-powered analytics dashboards and alerts emerged as essential tools for driving ongoing process improvements. The ability to detect trends, identify recurring root causes, and monitor compliance dynamically equips decision-makers with actionable insights to proactively mitigate risks.

👣 What’s Next?

We’re exploring pilot initiatives, both focused on intelligent exception handling and traceability assistants. The goal is to improve operational agility and compliance confidence while laying the foundation for more advanced AI capabilities.

If you’re working with serialization in SAP and wondering how to take the next step with AI, I’d be happy to share more or connect you with the right resources.

Let’s move beyond compliance - and into intelligence.

SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals

entry.title: Automatic payment block for non PO invoice
entry.content:
Hello

We have this requirement.

We want to have invoice approval workflow for all supplier invoices posted without PO (what we call FI invoice) and also for PO related invoices (MM invoices) if there is a price/quantity difference. We post our invoice with [Create supplier invoice]

To trigger the flexible workflow for blocked supplier invoice, the invoice must be booked with a payment bock. In order to have this payment block automatically (we don't want the user to apply a payment block manually to all invoices) we use  SSCUI 104420 and SSCUI 104419 so that system set a payment block to all invoices (threshold value 0.01, percentage 99.99).

The problem is that with this settings, all invoices have a payment block, even PO invoice without price/quantity différence 

Could you advice on a customizing to have

- all invoices posted without reference to PO having an automatic payment block

- invoices related to a PO have an automatic payment block only if there is a price/quantity difference.

Thanks

entry.title: Hu is getting created for me, but i cant pack stock in it. Do you guys have any references??
Navigating SAP Commerce Cloud Bug in SmartEdit: Analysis and Solutions
entry.content:
What's Happening?

After upgrading, you might find that canceling edits on nested components leads to disassociation between the component and its parent. A key line of code in the new version altered how exceptions are handled, resulting in a suppressed error that inadvertently sets components to null. This particular issue started impacting systems on July 3, 2025, and affects primary business processes without any immediate workaround.

How to Identify the Issue

Here’s how you can reproduce and identify this behavior in your environment:

  1. Advanced Editing
    Edit a page using the "Advance Edit" feature.
  2. Accessing Components
    Open a component on the page that includes a cmsLink or similar object.
  3. Nested Modals
    Click to open the cmsLink or object, which will display a nested modal.
  4. Cancel Without Changes
    Click "Cancel" without making any modifications. Notice the cmsLink is no longer linked to its parent component.

Why Does This Happen?

This issue originated from a code change in version 2211.41. The update altered exception handling, causing the system to suppress errors that previously prevented the component from being nullified. As a result, UI data integrity is compromised, potentially leading to negative effects on the user experience if deployed into production.

How Can You Fix It?

We're actively addressing this bug, and a fix is scheduled to roll out with SAP Commerce Cloud version 2211.43. In the interim, we recommend:

Temporary Workaround: Although the front-end appears to disconnect the link, it remains in the backend. By canceling and reopening the editor for the parent component, the link should reappear, preserving the user experience.

Conclusion

Managing component associations in SAP Commerce Cloud is crucial for maintaining website functionality. While awaiting the full fix, leveraging the temporary workaround ensures your operations continue unimpeded. For further assistance or guidance, don’t hesitate to contact SAP Support—we're committed to helping you resolve this issue promptly!
Optimize your workflow with these insights, and stay tuned for updates. We're here to support your success with SAP Commerce Cloud!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Extended Environment Access Level Functionality
entry.content:
Hi Dear Community Members!

Previously in the blogpost SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Introducing the Environment Access Management Screen we introduced you to Environment Access Management (EAM) Screen where administrators can set an environment access level security to control the visibility to their environments by setting them as either “Public” or “Private” which ensures that only authorized users have access to it.

To unlock its full potential, SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) is glad to announce the extended environment access level functionality where administrators can now start setting the environment access level from Environment Screen (Main) and Content Management. in this blogpost, I will walk you through the steps on how to do it from Creation, Editing, and even Copying of an environment to setting environment access level when importing a content to your tenant.

Before we proceed, it is important to take note that admin users must have the ENVIRONMENTS_ACCESS_ALL role which will play a crucial part in this extended functionality.

Let’s get started!

In the Environment and Content Management screens, we know that to manage environments your user must have at least the ENVIRONMENTS and CONTENTS role.

But now, if your user has a combined role ENVIRONMENTS_ACCESS_ALL, you will have this additional Access option.

Although this access option is comparable to what is presently available on the EAM screen, you can now define an environment to be either public or private and assign authorized teams from the moment it is created, edited, copied, or imported.

Create a private environment

  1. In the environment screen choose Add button
  2. Choose Environment
  3. In the Add Environment window, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Description
  4. In Access, by default public is chosen in this option but if you switch to Private, as an admin you will be able to choose and assign the Teams that will be authorized to see and access this environment.
  5. Then choose Add

Edit a public environment to private

  1. In the environment screen choose your environment
  2. Choose Edit
  3. In the Edit Environment window, choose the access level as Private  
  4. Choose the Authorized Teams
  5. Then choose Edit

Note: Private environments can also be edited as public, just choose Public in access.

Copy a public environment as private

  1. In the environment screen choose your environment
  2. Choose Add button, then choose Environment from
  3. In the Copy Environment window, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Description
  4. In Access, by default public is chosen in this option but if you switch to Private, as an admin you will be able to choose and assign the Teams that will be authorized to see and access this environment.
  5. Then choose Copy

Note: Private environments can also be copied as another private environment and the admin will have an option to either retain or change the assigned authorized teams.

Now, let’s take a look in Content Management screen. First thing that you will notice is a new column called Access which indicates if an environment in the list is public or private.

Let us understand how import works with this environment access level functionality!

Import a public environment and make it as private

  1. In the Content Management, choose the content that you want to import
  2. Choose Import button
  3. In the Import Environment, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Activate: Yes/No
    4. In the Access, choose Private
    5. Assign the Authorized Teams
  4. Then choose Import as New

Note: Private environments can also be imported as public, just choose Public in access.

But, what if you export a private environment with teams assigned to it? What will happen if you import this environment to a target tenant? Let’s answer that in the next scenarios.

  • Import a private environment with Team existing in both Source and Target tenants
  • Import a private environment with Team existing from Source but not existing in Target tenant

Import a private environment with Team existing in both Source and Target tenants

  1. In the Content Management, choose the content that you want to import
  2. Choose Import button
  3. In the Import Environment, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Activate: Yes/No
    4. In the Access, automatically this will be set as Private
    5. Assign or Unassign the Authorized Teams
  4. Then choose Import as New

Note: In the Authorized Teams, admin will have an option to either retain, change, or add more teams.

Import a private environment with Team existing from Source but not existing in Target tenant

  1. In the Content Management, choose the content that you want to import
  2. Choose Import button
  3. Create Missing Teams: Yes/No
  4. In the Import Environment, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Activate: Yes/No
    4. In the Access, automatically this will be set as Private
    5. Assign or Unassign the Authorized Teams
  5. Then choose Import as New

Note: The system will either create the missing teams if the teams that are currently assigned in the environment that will be imported are present in the target tenant. The administrator must then assign the users in the created team as users are not importable due to different team composition is different tenants. Or, totally not include the team in the import if Create Missing Teams = No.

Now, if you have gone through or already read the blogpost, SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Introducing the Environment Access Management Screen you should already know the conditions and expected result when an environment is created or imported as private which is explained in two (2) different scenarios with Privileged Role Access and Authorized Team Membership Granting Access.

That’s it! I hope the examples provided in this blogpost are able to show you the things that you need to know about the extended Environment Access Level Functionality. Now the only thing left is for you to explore. Till the next new features from SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model. Enjoy!

entry.title: changing the label count in the app Enter Time Ticket for Production Order (CO11N)
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts, 

in a S/4 HANA public cloud envorinment we have the following topic, Maybe one of you have an idea?:

Issue:
We want to able to change the label count of time ticket for production order.

Process:
In the app “Enter Time Ticket for Production Order(CO11N)”, with the production order and confirm type selected as “Final Confirmation”, time ticket is created and labels are starts printing.

Try outs:
We added a custom field to app to able able to enter label count(Screenshot2). We searched for a way to give that data to BADI’s.

CO11N is calling Migo in background and that we cannot pass the custom Label Field (Screenshot 1) to the standard label field and set the checkbox for the printing

We have looked for these BADI’s;

  • BD_WORKORDER_GOODSMOVT_BKF_GDR
  • FLOG_CHG_GR_DATA
  • MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA
  • MMIM_HEAD_PROVIDE_DATA

 

In some of these BADI’s we found “number of labels to be printed” in their importing parameters but we require it to be in their changing parameters.

Best regards,

Luisa

entry.title: Re: How Can I transfer data from One client to another /s...
entry.content:
Hello @sonia260165 

The data is kept in the /SCWM/STADET_OUT which has delivery class = A (master and application data)

The standard way is manual maintenance in the destination system.

If you are savvy transport system, you can add /SCWM/STADET_OUT entries manually to a transport with R3TR TABU object. Be sure to know what you are doing, if you chose this option.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Hu is getting created for me, but i cant pack stock i...
entry.content:
When you create a discussion and expecting some inputs from this forum, please see that you create the discussion with as much information as possible so that, it will be easy for the members to understand the issue. You have not even added the issue in the text. Just by reading the subject alone is not suffice to assist you.

In order to understand better whether it is because of process issue or configuration issue, please clarify the following:

  • Are you working in an outbound or inbound delivery because, the packing logic differs between the two.
  • Is the HU created manually or automatically during the process? This will determine if it is a config or process issue.
  • What error message you were getting when trying to pack the stock ? Please share a screen shot of that error message
  • Is the material HU-managed in the material master?

entry.title: Re: oDataService Request is called multiple times
entry.content:
Hi AnilTripathy, As I guess in your controller check below statement is there anywhere.

This.getView().getModel().refresh() or
This.getOwnerComponent.getModel().refresh()

These statements may not effect in Dev environment some times because of oData model versions,
in higher environments, Some cases I have observed issue with these statements.

Resolution:
Handle them with Named model refresh in controllers.
